extendedIngredients.name: artichoke hearts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (14-ounce) can water-packed artichoke hearts, rinsed, drained and coarsley chopped (divided)

extendedIngredients.name: garlic clove
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 small garlic clove, minced or pressed

extendedIngredients.name: spinach
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry

extendedIngredients.name: vegetable mix
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (0.4 ounce) packet dry vegetable soup mix (I prefer Knorr's)

recipes.title: Cold Spinach and Artichoke Dip

winePairing.pairingText: Dip can be paired with Sparkling rosé and Sparkling Wine. If you're serving a selection of appetizers, you can't go wrong with these. Both are very food friendly and complement a variety of flavors. The Bellissima Sparkling rosé with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 24 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Bellissima Sparkling Rose
productMatches.description: This is an elegant, bright rosé, with hints of strawberry and grapefruit, and a soft, persistent foam. Uncorked at the very last minute, Bellissima Sparkling Rosé pairs perfectly with smoked salmon, shellfish, and seafood hor d’oeuvres such as tuna tartare, sushi, and sashimi.

recipes.instructions: In a food processor, add half of the chopped artichokes, cream cheese, Parmesan, sour cream, garlic, soup mix, and 3 tablespoons water. Process until smooth and creamy.Transfer to a mixing bowl and fold in the remaining artichokes, scallions, and spinach. Refrigerate for two hours prior to serving.Store in an airtight container up to 2 days.

steps.step: In a food processor, add half of the chopped artichokes, cream cheese, Parmesan, sour cream, garlic, soup mix, and 3 tablespoons water. Process until smooth and creamy.
Transfer to a mixing bowl and fold in the remaining artichokes, scallions, and spinach. Refrigerate for two hours prior to serving.Store in an airtight container up to 2 days.
